title: COPA chairmanship to be given to opposition, COPE chair from ruling party
byline: Leader of the House, Minister Bimal Rathnayake, announced today (6) that the position of Chairman of the Committee on Public Accounts (COPA) will be granted to the opposition.

title: 14-year-old girl found murdered and dumped in toilet pit
byline: The remains of a 14-year-old girl who had been murdered and her body dumped in a toilet pit under construction in the Akarawita area of Gampaha has been discovered.

title: US Assistant Secretary Donald Lu calls on Sri Lanka’s foreign minister
byline: A U.S. delegation led by Assistant Secretary of State for the Bureau of South and Central Asian Affairs (SCA), Donald Lu, met with Sri Lanka’s Foreign Minister, Vijitha Herath today (06).

title: Pakistan’s jailed former PM Imran Khan threatens civil disobedience movement
byline: Pakistan’s jailed former Prime Minister Imran Khan has called on his supporters to hold a rally next week and threatened to start a civil disobedience movement days after his party led a deadly protest march in Islamabad.

title: Shammi Silva assumes Presidency of Asian Cricket Council
byline: The Asian Cricket Council (ACC) today announced that Mr. Shammi Silva, President of Sri Lanka Cricket, has officially assumed the Presidency of the ACC.

title: Interim order issued against increasing liquor license fees
byline: The Supreme Court has issued an interim injunction order preventing the implementation of a Gazette notification issued by the previous government to increase the  annual fee for liquor licenses.

title: Kerala cannabis worth over Rs. 18 mln found adrift off Delft
byline: The Sri Lanka Navy has seized approximately 45.5 kg of Kerala cannabis found adrift in the waters during a special operation conducted in the sea area near Delft Island, Jaffna.

title: Trump appoints former PayPal exec David Sacks as AI and crypto czar
byline: U.S. President-elect Donald Trump on Thursday said he was appointing former PayPal Chief Operating Officer David Sacks as his “White House A.I. & Crypto Czar,” another step towards overhauling U.S. policy.

title: Vote on Account passed in Parliament without a vote
byline: The Resolution on the Vote on Account for the first four months of 2025 was passed in Parliament today (6) without a vote.

title: Lohan Ratwatte arrested over drunk driving accident
byline: Former State Minister Lohan Ratwatte, who was released on bail yesterday, has been arrested at Kollupitiya following a traffic accident.

title: CEB submits proposal to PUCSL to continue with existing tariffs
byline: The Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) has submitted its electricity tariff revision proposal to the Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka (PUCSL).

title: US Assistant Secretary of State calls on PM Harini Amarasuriya
byline: U.S. Assistant Secretary of State for South and Central Asian Affairs, Mr. Donald Lu, paid a courtesy call on Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya at the Parliament of Sri Lanka.

title: MP Dilith Jayaweera advocates for govt accountability
byline: ‘Sarvajana Balaya’ Member of Parliament, Dilith Jayaweera emphasized the party’s commitment to guiding the government on the right path over the next five years.

title: Showery conditions expected to enhance in next few days - Met Dept.
byline: The Meteorology Department says an easterly wave type disturbance will be affecting the weather conditions in the island in next few days.

title: South Korean president apologizes, saying he won’t shirk responsibility for attempt at martial law
byline: South Korea’s president apologized Saturday for public anxiety caused by his short-lived attempt to impose martial law earlier this week hours ahead of a parliamentary vote on impeaching him.

title: Minister proposes providing sewn school uniforms to students
byline: Minister of Industries and Entrepreneurship Development, Sunil Hadunnetti, announced plans to provide sewn school uniforms to students in the future in order to minimize wastage in uniform distribution.

title: Former airman arrested at BIA with Rs. 3m in smuggled cigarettes
byline: Officers of the Police Narcotics Bureau (PNB) at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) have seized a large consignment of smuggled foreign cigarettes valued at around Rs. 3 million, and arrested a suspect at the BIA early this morning (07).

title: Syrian rebels seize fourth city, close in on Homs in threat to Assad’s rule
byline: Syrian rebels said they seized control of the southern city of Daraa on Saturday, the birthplace of a 2011 uprising against President Bashar al-Assad and the fourth city his forces have lost in a week.

title: Two killed in motorcycle accident in Dodangoda
byline: Two people were reportedly killed in an accident when their motorcycle crashed into a tree in the Nehinna area on the Dodangoda, Getagahahena-Nehinna road last night (6).

title: Harry Potter TV show to start filming in summer
byline: Production of the new HBO TV series of Harry Potter will begin in summer 2025 at a UK studio, it has been announced.

title: CEB slammed over proposal not to revise electricity tariffs
byline: Numerous parties have voiced strong opposition to the Ceylon Electricity Board’s (CEB) recent proposal to the Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka (PUCSL) to maintain the existing electricity tariffs without any revision for the next six months.

title: Former state minister Lohan Ratwatte remanded
byline: Former State Minister Lohan Ratwatte, who was arrested yesterday for causing a road accident while driving under the influence of alcohol, has been remanded until December 09 after being produced before the Colombo Chief Magistrate’s Court today (7).

title: ‘New Rathna’ Rice Mill owner responds to Trade Minister’s claims
byline: The owner of ‘New Rathna’ Rice Mill, Lankeshwara Mithrapala, has invited Trade Minister Wasantha Samarasinghe to personally inspect the company’s rice production facilities in the wake of the minister’s statement in Parliament yesterday (6) accusing large-scale rice millers of stockpiling.
